org.apache.taverna.configuration.app.impl

Class ApplicationConfigurationImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.taverna.configuration.app.impl.ApplicationConfigurationImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ApplicationConfiguration

    public class ApplicationConfigurationImpl
extends Object
implements ApplicationConfiguration
    Represent the application config as it has been specified in . This configuration specifies the application's name and title, etc.

    An application would typically provide the file on the classpath under a conf directory, or in a conf directory in the application's distribution directory.

    Author:
    Stian Soiland-Reyes, David Withers

      • loadProperties

        protected Properties loadProperties(String resourceName)
        Attempt to load application properties from propertyFileName.

        Will attempt to load a property file from the locations below. The first non-empty properties successfully loaded will be returned.

        1. $startup/conf/$resourceName
        2. $startup/$resourceName
        3. $contextClassPath/conf/$resourceName
        4. $contextClassPath/$resourceName
        5. $classpath/conf/$resourceName
        6. $classpath/$resourceName

        Where $startup is this application's startup directory as determined by getStartupDir(), and $contextClassPath means a search using ClassLoader.getResources(String) from the classloader returned by Thread.getContextClassLoader() and then again $classpath for the classloader of Object.getClass() of this instance.

        If none of these sources could find a non-empty property file, a warning is logged, and an empty Properties instance is returned.

        Parameters:
        resourceName - Relative filename of property file
        Returns:
        Loaded or empty Properties instance.
